title: What can I do if I can't access the Internet after my Y336-A1 data service is turned on?
answer:
l   Make sure your SIM card is properly inserted. For details, see the Quick Start Guide that comes with your phone. 

l   Make sure your phone supports the SIM card mode. For details, contact your SIM card vendor. 

l   Make sure you have subscribed to a data plan for your SIM card. For details, contact your service provider. 

l   Make sure your SIM card has sufficient balance. Your service provider may stop providing Internet access to SIM cards that have a negative balance. 

l   Go to the **Settings** screen, and touch **More...** > **Data usage** to check whether you have set a limit for data usage. If so, you will not be able to use data services when the limit is met. Remove the limit or set a larger value. 

**Figure 1-1 **

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141021234441659001.jpg)

l   Restore the APN settings to their default values. 

Go to the **Settings** screen, touch **Mobile networks** > **Access Point Names**, touch ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141021234441909002.gif) > **Reset to default**, and then try again. 

**Figure 1-2 **

![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=SupportImage&imagePath=/20141021234441704003.jpg)

                                      Note: The figures are for
your reference only. The actual screens may vary.
